pull.title: Boost unit-testing framework.
pull.body:
make -f makefile.{unix,osx,mingw} test_bitcoin
to compile dumb, do-almost-nothing placeholder unit tests.

repo.name: bitcoin-git
repo.description: Feature branches that aren't yet, or never will be, ready for mainline bitcoin

events.message:
Boost unit-testing framework.
make -f makefile.{unix,osx,mingw} test_bitcoin
to compile dumb, do-almost-nothing placeholder unit tests.

events.body: Nice, here's hoping someone has the time to write a ton of these.

Hooray for unit testing!
@TheBlueMatt what I find the easiest way of writing tests is to actually write a failing test before correcting a bug, this way you just write tests progressively and easily prevent regressions
I forgot to thank Steve (gasteve in IRC) for the original code. Thanks Steve!

issue.title: build: Remove unused src/obj-test folder
issue.body: I believe this is no longer used after we switched from a makefile to autotools
